question.title: What is a post-paralytic facial hemispasm?
question.description: A type of facial paralysis that occurs after a stroke or other neurological event

option_a.title: A type of facial spasm that occurs after a head injury
option_a.description: A condition characterized by a sudden, involuntary contraction of facial muscles

option_b.title: A type of facial paralysis that is permanent
option_b.description: A condition that affects the facial nerve, causing weakness or paralysis of the face

option_c.title: A type of facial paralysis that is caused by a viral infection
option_c.description: A condition that affects the nerve cells in the brain, causing weakness or paralysis of the face

option_d.title: A type of facial paralysis that is reversible with treatment
option_d.description: A condition that affects the facial nerve, causing weakness or paralysis of the face, but can be cured with medication or surgery

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The first letter of the correct option
